original: Bengtsson, Bengt Algot, skeppsmäklare, Göteborg, f. 30/1/84 i F:i’s-kebäckskil, Gbgs o. Boh. 1. G. 17 m. Magdalena Parelius. Barn: Åke f. 17, fil. kand., Upps., Kerstin 21, fil. kand., g. m. di’sp. Göran Z. Häggström, Uppis. — Res. t. Engl. o. Tyskl. uppr. ggr. Dir. f. A-B Herman Holmberg i Gbg sed. 20. Led. av styr. f. Bogströms Stuveri A-B m. fl. Hobbies: segl., fiske, konst O’. 1’itteratur.
translated: Bengt Algot Bengtsson was a ship broker from Gothenburg. He was born on January 30, 1884, in Fiskebäckskil, Gothenburg and Bohuslän. He was married to Magdalena Parelius for 17 years and they had two children - Åke, born in 1917, who had a degree in philosophy from Uppsala University, and Kerstin, born in 1921, who had a degree in philosophy and was married to di'sp. Göran Z. Häggström from Uppsala. Bengtsson travelled to England and Germany multiple times. He was the director of A-B Herman Holmberg in Gothenburg since 1920 and a member of the board of Bogströms Stuveri A-B and others. His hobbies included sailing, fishing, art, and literature.
